author: zhenggu
body:
Fix Split-Path -Parent /foo returns the empty string on unix. (#4134) 

I have reviewed the source code and found if we pass "/foo" to the Cmdlet.
We must get an empty string from
string result = GetParentPath(provider, pathNoQualifier, root, context);
for pathNoQualifier = "foo", and root is an empty string, we cannot determine it's parent is / or not.

And one more question is that I am still confused on the provider-qualified path, which has "::", can anyone give me an example.
title: Fix Split-Path -Parent /foo returns the empty string on unix. (#4134)
